intro: Arnica tenuis, commonly known as slender arnica, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and hairy foliage. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with lance-shaped leaves and yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late summer. Its rhizomatous root system allows it to thrive in well-drained, rocky soils. Arnica tenuis is often used in traditional medicine for its anti-inflammatory and analgesic properties.
